content.description: Central Perk, everyone is there except Joey.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Alright. Phoebe?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Okay, okay. If I were omnipotent for a day, I would want, um, world peace, no more hunger, good things for the rain-forest…And bigger boobs!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yeah, see.. you took mine. Chandler, what about you?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Uh, if I were omnipotent for a day, I’d.. make myself omnipotent forever.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: See, there’s always one guy. (Mocking) “If I had a wish, I’d wish for three more wishes.” (Joey enters.)

content.speaker: All
content.text: Hey Joey. Hi. Hey, buddy.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Hey, Joey, what would you do if you were omnipotent?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Probably kill myself!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: ..Excuse me?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey, if Little Joey’s dead, then I got no reason to live!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Joey, uh- OM nipotent.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: You are ? Ross, I’m sorry..

content.description: Central Perk, Ross and Monica are watching Phoebe sleep.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: How does she do that?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I cannot sleep in a public place.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Would you look at her? She is so peaceful.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh! What what what! …Hi.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: It’s okay, y’know, you just nodded off again.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: What’s going on with you?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: I got no sleep last night!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Why?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: My grandmother has this new boyfriend, and they’re both kind of insecure in bed. Oh, and deaf. So they’re constantly, like, having to reassure each other that they’re having a good time. You have no idea how loud they are!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Well, if you want, you can stay with Rachel and me tonight.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Thanks.
(Chandler and Joey enter. Joey is counting his steps.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: …Ninety-five, ninety-six, ninety-seven. See, I told you! Less than a hundred steps from our place to here.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: You got waaaay too much free time.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey! Here’s the birthday boy! Ross, check it out: hockey tickets, Rangers-Penguins, tonight at the Garden, and we’re taking you.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Happy birthday, pal!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: We love you, man. (Kisses Ross)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Funny, my birthday was seven months ago.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: So?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: So, I’m guessing you had an extra ticket and couldn’t decide which one of you got to bring a date?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Well, aren’t we Mr. “The glass is half empty.”

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh my God, oh- is today the twentieth, October twentieth?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh, I was hoping you wouldn’t remember.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Ohhh.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: What’s wrong with the twentieth?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Eleven days before Halloween.. all the good costumes are gone?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Today’s the day Carol and I first.. consummated our physical relationship. (Joey is puzzled.) Sex. ..You know what, I-I’d better pass on the game. I think I’m just gonna go home and think about my ex-wife and her lesbian lover.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: The hell with hockey, let’s all do that!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: C’mon, Ross! You, me, Joey, ice, guys’ night out, c’mon, whaddya say, big guy, (Pretending to punch him in the stomach.) Huh? Huh? Huh?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: What are you doing?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I have no idea.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: C’mon, Ross!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Alright, alright, maybe it’ll take my mind off it. Do you promise to buy me a big thumb finger?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: You got it.
(Rachel runs up cluching an envelope.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Look-look-look-look-look, my first pay check! Look at the window, there’s my name! Hi, me!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: I remember the day I got my first pay check. There was a cave in in one of the mines, and eight people were killed.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Wow, you worked in a mine?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: I worked in a Dairy Queen , why?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: God, isn’t this exciting? I earned this. I wiped tables for it, I steamed milk for it, and it was totally—(opens envelope)—not worth it. Who’s FICA? Why’s he getting all my money? I mean, what- Chandler, look at that.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh, this is not that bad.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh, you’re fine, yeah, for a first job.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: You can totally, totally live on this.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Yeah, yeah.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh, by the way, great service tonight.

content.speaker: All
content.text: Oh! Yeah!
(They all get their wallets out and give generous tips.)

content.speaker: Guys
content.text: Hockey! (They go to leave but are blocked by three of Rachel’s friends, Leslie, Kiki, and Joanne. The guys pause to stare at them.) Hockey! Hockey. (The guys.)

content.speaker: Leslie
content.text: Rachel?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh my God! (Rachel, Leslie, Kiki, and Joanne all scream and hug each other.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I swear I’ve seen birds do this on Wild Kingdom .

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: What are you guys doing here?

content.speaker: Kiki
content.text: Well, we were in the city shopping, and your mom said you work here, aaand it’s true!

content.speaker: Joanne
content.text: Look at you in the apron. You look like you’re in a play.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Look at you, you are so big I can’t believe it!

content.speaker: Leslie
content.text: I know. I know! I’m a duplex.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: So what’s going on with you?

content.speaker: Joanne
content.text: Well, guess who my dad’s making partner in his firm? (She points to herself and they all scream again.)

content.speaker: Kiki
content.text: And while we’re on the subject of news.. (She holds up here finger to show off her engagement ring and they all scream again.)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Look, look, I have elbows! (They scream.)

content.description: A Street, Chandler and Joey are kicking a can to each other.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: …Poulet passes it up to Leetch! (Passes it to Joey.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Leetch spots Messier in the crease- there’s the pass! (He kicks it to Ross, but Ross is staring into a shop window.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: We’ll take a brief time out while Messier stops to look at some women’s shoes.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Carol was wearing boots just like those the night that we- we first- y’know. Fact, she, uh- she never took ’em off, ’cause we-we- (off Chandler’s look) Sorry. Sorry.
(They walk on. Chandler and Joey start to talk but Ross stops and whines.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: What?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Peach pit.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yes, Bunny?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Peach pit. That night we, uh- we had-

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: -Peaches?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Actually, nectarines, but basically…

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Could’ve been a peach.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Then, uh, then we got dressed, and I-I… I walked her to the- (looks up, realises, and points) -the bus stop… I’m fine.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey, that woman’s got an ass like Carol’s! (They turn to stare at him.) What? Thought we were trying to find stuff.

content.description: Central Perk, Rachel, Lesile, Kiki, and Joanne are talking.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: So c’mon, you guys, tell me all the dirt!

content.speaker: Kiki
content.text: Well, the biggest news is still you dumping Barry at the altar!

content.speaker: Joanne
content.text: Alright. Let’s talk reality for a second.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Okay.

content.speaker: Joanne
content.text: When are you coming home?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: What? Guys, I’m not.

content.speaker: Joanne
content.text: C’mon, this is us.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I’m not! This is what I’m doing now. I’ve got this job-

content.speaker: Kiki
content.text: Waitressing?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Okay, I’m not just waitressing. I’m.. I, um… I write the specials on the specials board, and, uh… and I, uh… I take the uh dead flowers out of the vase… Oh, and, um, sometimes Artelle lets me put the little chocolate blobbies on the cookies.

content.speaker: Leslie
content.text: Well. Your mom didn’t tell us about the blobbies.

content.description: Monica and Rachel’s, Phoebe and Monica are in pajamas and Monica is making something in the blender as Rachel enters.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Hey, Rach. How was it with your friends? (She and Phoebe scream.) Okay! How would you like some Tiki Death Punch? (She pours the contents of the blender into some glasses.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: What’s that?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Weeeell, it’s rum, and-

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Okay. (Grabs the blender and starts to drink.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: We thought since Phoebe was staying over tonight we’d have kinda like a slumber party thing. We got some trashy magazines, we got cookie dough, we got Twister … (The phone rings and Monica answers it.)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Ooh! Ooh! And I brought Operation ! But, um, I lost the tweezers, so we can’t operate. But we can prep the guy!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Uh, Rach, it’s the Visa card people.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh, God, ask them what they want.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Could you please tell me what this is in reference to? (Listens) Yes, hold on. (To Rachel) Um, they say there’s been some unusual activity on your account.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: But I haven’t used my card in weeks!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: That is the unusual activity. Look, they just wanna see if you’re okay.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: They wanna know if I’m okay. Okay.. they wanna know if I’m okay, okay, let’s see. Well, let’s see, the FICA guys took all my money, everyone I know is either getting married, or getting promoted, or getting pregnant, and I’m getting coffee! And it’s not even for me! So if that sounds like I’m okay, okay, then you can tell them I’m okay, okay?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Uh- Rachel has left the building, can you call back?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Alright, c’mon! (Miserably) Let’s play Twister !

content.description: [Scene: Madison Square Garden, the guys are trying to find their seats.]

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Sorry, sorry… Uh-oh.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: What? There was ice there that night with Carol? Plastic seats? Four thousand angry Pittsburgh fans?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: No, actually I was just saying it looks like we’re not sitting together. But now you mention it, there was ice there that night… It was the first frost…

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: C’mon, sit. Just sit down, sit.

content.description: Monica and Rachel’s, they’re all hanging out in the living room.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: You should feel great about yourself! You’re doing this amazing independence thing!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Monica, what is so amazing? I gave up, like, everything. And for what?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: You are just like Jack.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: …Jack from downstairs?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: No, Jack and the Beanstalk.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Ah, the other Jack.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yeah, right! See, he gave up something, but then he got those magic beans. And then he woke up, and there was this, this big plant outside his window, full of possibilities and stuff.. And he lived in a village, and you live in the Village..

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Okay, but Pheebs, Pheebs, Jack gave up a cow, I gave up an orthodontist. Okay, I-I-I know, I know I didn’t love him-

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh, see, Jack did love the cow.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: But see, it was a plan. Y’know, it was clear. It was figured out, and now everything’s just kinda like…

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Floopy?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yeah.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: So what, you’re not the only one. I mean, half the time we don’t know where we’re going. You’ve just gotta figure at some point it’s all gonna come together, and it’s just gonna be… un-floopy.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh, like that’s a word.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Okay, but Monica, what if- what if it doesn’t come together?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: …Pheebs?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh, well… ’cause… you just… I don’t like this question.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Okay, see, see, you guys, what if we don’t get magic beans? I mean, what if all we’ve got are.. beans?

content.description: [Scene: Madison Square Garden, the guys are watching the game.]

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Get him! GET HIM! Get him! Get- YESSS! Not laughing now, are ya pal!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: See buddy, that’s all you need, a bunch of toothless guys hitting each other with sticks.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Pass it! Pass it!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: He’s open!

content.speaker: All
content.text: Shoot! Shoot! Shoot!
(The player shoots and the puck flies off the rink and hits Ross in the face. Chandler looks concered until he notices…)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Hey, look, we’re on that TV thing!
(Chandler and Joey hold the puck and wave at the TV thing.)

content.description: An Emergency Room, Chandler and Joey are leading Ross in.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: ’scuse me.

content.speaker: Receptionist
content.text: It says to call this number if you’re not completely satisfied with this candy bar. Well, I’m not completely satisfied.
content.parenthetical: holds up her hand—she is on the phone

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Listen, it’s kind of an emergency. Well, I guess you know that, or we’d be in the predicament room. (The receptionist glares at him.)

content.speaker: Receptionist
content.text: Hold on. (To Chandler) Fill these out, sit over there. (Tosses him some forms.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Look, I don’t wanna make any trouble, okay, but I’m in a lot of pain here, alright? My face is dented .

content.speaker: Receptionist
content.text: Well, you’ll have to wait your turn.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Well, how long do you think it’ll be?

content.speaker: Receptionist
content.text: Any minute now.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hey, this- (she gives him a look and the guys back off) Heyy…

content.description: Monica and Rachel’s, the slumber party continues.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I’m so sorry, you guys. I didn’t mean to bring you down.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: No, you were right. I don’t have a plan. (There’s a knock on the door.)

content.speaker: Pizza Guy
content.text: Pizza guy!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Thank God. Food. (She goes to answer the door.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Phoebe?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: What?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Do you have a plan?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: I don’t even have a ‘pl’.

content.speaker: Pizza Guy
content.text: Hi, one, uh, mushroom, green pepper and onion?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: No, no, that’s not what we ordered… We ordered a fat-free crust with extra cheese.

content.speaker: Pizza Guy
content.text: Wait, you’re not ‘G. Stephanopoulos’? Man, my dad’s gonna kill me!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Wait! Did you say ‘G. Stephanopoulos’?
content.parenthetical: leaping off of the couch and runs up

content.speaker: Pizza Guy
content.text: Yeah. This one goes across the street, I must have given him yours. Oh, bonehead, bonehead!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Wait, was this a-a small mediterranean guy with curiously intelligent good looks?

content.speaker: Pizza Guy
content.text: Yeah, that sounds about right.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Was he wearing a stunning blue suit?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: And-and a power tie?

content.speaker: Pizza Guy
content.text: No, pretty much just a towel.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh God.

content.speaker: Pizza Guy
content.text: So you guys want me to take this back?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Are you nuts?! We’ve got George Stephanopoulos’ pizza! (Rachel pays him, Monica grabs some binoculars, and runs to the window.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Uh, Pheebs? Who’s George Snuffalopagus?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Big Bird’s friend.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I see pizza!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh, I wanna see! Lemme see! Lemme see! (She runs up and takes the binoculars.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Hello? Who are we spying on?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: White House adviser? Clinton’s campaign guy? The one with the great hair, sexy smile, really cute butt?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh, him, the little guy? Oh, I love him!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Ooh, wait.. wait, I see a woman.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Please tell me it’s his mother.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Definitely not his mother.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh, no…

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh, wait, she’s walking across the floor.. she’s walking.. she’s walking.. she’s going for the pizza- (Yelling) Hey, that’s not for you, bitch! (Phoebe covers her mouth with her hand walks away from the window.)

content.description: The Emergency Room, Joey is miming hockey pucks kitting foreheads. Chandler realises it’s getting tense and goes to the receptionist again.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Excuse me, look, we’ve been here for over an hour, and a lot of people less sick than my friend have gone in. I mean, that guy with the toe thing? Who’s he sleeping with? (She slides the gladd panel over and Chandler talks through it in a loud voice.) Oh, c’mon Dora, don’t be mad… I know we both said some things we didn’t mean, but that doesn’t mean we still don’t love each other. (To the waiting room.) Y’know, I feel like I’ve lost her.. (She slides the panel back, he turns, and it takes him by surprise.) Ba-!

content.description: Monica and Rachel’s, the girls are all out on the balcony.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Light still out?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yeah.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh. Maybe they’re- napping.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh please, they’re having sex.

content.speaker: Monica and Phoebe
content.text: Shut up!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: So, whaddya think George is like?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I think he’s shy.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yeah?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Yeah. I think you have to draw him out. And then- when you do- he’s a preppy animal.

content.description: The Emergency Room, Ross is still going on about his first night with Carol.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I remember the moonlight coming through the window- and her face had the most incredible glow.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yes, the moon, the glow, the magical feeling, you did this part- Could I get some painkillers over here, please?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: He’s right, enough, already. What is the big deal about today? So you slept with her for the first time, so what? You slept with her for seven years after that.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Look, it’s just a little more complicated…

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Well, what? What? What is it? That she left you? That she likes women? That she left you for another woman that likes women?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Little louder, okay, I think there’s a man on the twelfth floor in a coma that didn’t quite hear you…

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Then what?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: My first time with Carol was… (He mumbles the last part)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: What?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: It was my first time .

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: With Carol? (Ross gives him a look.) Oh.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: So in your whole life, you’ve only been with one—(He gets a look too)—oh.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Whoah, boy, hockey was a big mistake! There was a whole bunch of stuff we could’ve done tonight!

content.description: Monica and Rachel’s, the girls are still out on the balcony.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Okay. Okay, I got one. Do you remember that vegetarian pate that I made that you loved so much?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Uh-huh.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Well, unless goose is a vegetable…ha haaaah!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh! Oh! Oh! Okay, fine, fine. Now I don’t feel so bad about sleeping with Jason Hurley.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: What?! You slept with Jason?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: You’d already broken up.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: How long?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: A couple hours.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh, that’s nice!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Okay, okay, okay, I got one! (She sits up and the cushion she was leaning against falls off of the balcony.) Anyway- The valentine Tommy Rollerson left in your locker was really from me.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Excuse me?!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Hello? Like he was really gonna send you one? (To Phoebe) She was a big girl .

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Really. Well, at least ‘big girls’ don’t pee in their pants in seventh grade!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I was laughing! You made me laugh! (Monica and Rachel start to squabble)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: There he is! There he is!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Where?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Right- where we’ve been looking all night!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: He is so cute!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh, George, baby, drop the towel!

content.speaker: All
content.text: Yeah, drop it! Drop the towel! Please drop the—(pause)—wowww.

content.description: The Emergency Room, Ross is absent.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Man. Can you believe he’s only had sex with one woman?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I think it’s great. Y’know, it’s sweet, it’s romantic…

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Really?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: No, you kidding? The guy’s a freak.. (Ross enters off camera)

content.speaker: Both
content.text: Hey, buddy.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hi. (He is wearing a piece of steel bandaged to his nose. He tosses some forms onto reception desk.)

content.speaker: Receptionist
content.text: Oh, that’s attractive.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh, I thought you were great in Silence of the Lambs. Oh come on, admit it! All things considered, you had fun tonight.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Fun? Where was the fun? Tell me specifically, which part was the fun part? Where’s my puck?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh, ah- the kid has it.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: The kid…? (To the kid) Excuse me, uh, that’s, that’s my puck.

content.speaker: Kid
content.text: I found it. Finders keepers, losers weepers. (Ross looks at Chandler for help.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: You gotta do it, man.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh yeah? Well, I’m rubber, you’re glue, whatever—(to Chandler)—can’t do it. (to the kid) Listen, uh- gimme back my puck.

content.speaker: Kid
content.text: No.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: ‘Yes’, how about. C’mere. Gimme!

content.speaker: Kid
content.text: No! No! (They start to fight over it.)

content.speaker: Receptionist
content.text: Hey! Hey! No rough holding in my ER!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: GIVE ME MY PUCK!! (but it files out of his grasp and knocks out the receptionist)
content.parenthetical: tries to snatch it from the kid

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: …Now that was fun.

content.description: Monica and Rachel’s, Joey and the girls are playing twister.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Okay, Monica: Right foot red.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Could’ve played Monopoly , but nooooo.
(There’s a knock on the door, Chandler opens it, and silently hands back the cushion.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Thanks. (The guy nods and leaves)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Okay, Pheebs: Right hand blue. (Phoebe has to bend over.)Good. (Joey stares at her butt appreciatively)
(The phone rings and Chandler answers it.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Hello? Oh, uh, Rachel, it’s the Visa card people.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh, okay. Will you take my place?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Alright. (on phone) Yes, this is Rachel.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Nooo! (She grabs the phone and Chandler takes her place on the mat.) (On phone) Hello? (Listens) Oh, yeah, no, I know, I-I haven’t been using it much. (Listens) Oh, well, thanks, but, I’m okay, really.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Green. To the green.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I’ve got magic beans. (Listens) Never-never mind.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: To the left, to the left- aww! (They all collapse)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Ohhh… I’m fine.
